feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 3 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 2 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: System struggles with accurate leap year day inclusion in service duration and gratuity calculations
findings.issue_explanation: Multiple tickets revealed inconsistent handling of February 29th and total service days in leap years
findings.limitation_statement: Platform does not automatically adjust calculations to include 366 days in leap years

findings.group_description: Multiple independent daily wage calculation configurations create inconsistent results across different payroll scenarios
findings.issue_explanation: Leave salary, salary proration, and gratuity calculations use different daily wage divisors and methods
findings.limitation_statement: No unified mechanism for configuring daily wage calculations across different payroll functions

findings.group_description: Inconsistent handling of unpaid leave deductions across payroll and time-off modules
findings.issue_explanation: System fails to properly synchronize leave requests, public holidays, and payroll deductions
findings.limitation_statement: No real-time communication between time-off and payroll modules for accurate deduction calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual verification steps for gratuity calculations involving leap years
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Manually confirm total service days, ensuring 366 days are counted for 2024
2. Verify daily wage calculation uses correct divisor (366 for leap years)
3. Prorate partial years by dividing actual days by 366

troubleshooting.group_description: Steps to verify correct unpaid leave deduction calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Check global daily rate configuration
2. Verify working days calculation excluding public holidays
3. Confirm salary component used matches policy (basic vs gross)
4. Manually reconcile deductions if system calculation differs

glossary.definition: The number of days used to calculate an employee's daily rate, which can vary between 30, 30.42, or 365/366 depending on configuration
Days counted for salary calculations, which may exclude weekends and public holidays based on employee work week configuration
